intro: Oerstedella lactea, commonly known as the milky milkweed, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a defining feature of the genus. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
